intro: Lasianthus pedunculatus subsp. angustisepalus, commonly known as the narrow-sepaled lasianthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of bright red or orange flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
